channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Network Maintenance to be Performed July 24
item.description: Due to necessary hardware maintenance, a scheduled network outage will take place from approximately 5:00AM to 7:00AM on Wednesday, July 24. During this time, both on- and off-campus network connectivity will be unavailable, including wired and wireless connectivity, IP phones, and any other service which relies on network connectivity.
item.author: Community

item.title: Campus Community Invited to Cybersecurity Meetup with FBI, ISC2
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 24, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - All are welcome to join the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory and DotCIO in Carnegie 113 for the first meeting of the new ISC2 Capital District NY Chapter, which will meet monthly. This month, Samantha Baltzersen, Supervisory Special Agent in Charge of Cyber for Albany FBI Field Office, will give a talk. Please contact Dr. Callahan if you have questions.
item.author: Community

item.title: DotCIO Schedules License Server Maintenance for Evenings of July 22-23
item.description: From 5:30PM to 8PM ET on Monday and Tuesday, July 22 and 23, DotCIO staff will be performing maintenance on the license servers used for software activation on campus. License servers will be restarted during this time, so those who use the software that utilizes these license servers may temporarily experience license activation issues.
item.author: Community

item.title: Be a Part of the Incoming RPI Student Sendoff!
item.description: From 1PM to 3PM on Sunday, August 11 at Pat’s Barn in the Rensselaer Technology Park, come join the RPI Alumni Chapter of Hudson Mohawk to meet and welcome local first-year students from the Class of 2028! It’s a great way to enjoy food and refreshments while making connections, sharing stories, and networking with our newest class. The cost is $10 per person; all local current and incoming RPI students area are invited free of charge courtesy of the Hudson Mohawk Chapter alumni.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Center of Gravity” Series Continues July 24
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 24, 2024 4:00 PM - 10:00 PM - The Center of Gravity is your one-stop for personal, academic and well-being success this summer! Activities include novelty food and snacks, academic support from peer tutors and course TAs, away semester searches with the CCPD, wellness and well-being activities, water coloring, Legos, book clubs and more, so be sure to visit weekly!
item.author: Community

item.title: Don’t Miss Easton’s 11th Birthday “Pawty”!
item.description: Date: Thursday, July 25, 2024 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM - The campus community is invited to help Presidential Pup Eaton Schmidt celebrate his 11th birthday! Just come to the Freshman Quad near Barton Hall, where Easton and his younger sister Jofa will be eagerly waiting to greet everyone. There will also be frozen novelty treats served, so be sure to stop by on your way to or from lunch to enjoy the “pawty”!
item.author: Community

item.title: Philadelphia Orchestra to Accompany SPAC Screening of “Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix™”
item.description: Date: Saturday, August 3, 2024 7:30 PM - Relive the magic with Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix™ displayed on a giant screen in high definition, accompanied by The Philadelphia Orchestra’s live performance of Nicholas Hooper’s iconic score! Limited free tickets and transportation to SPAC will be available to students at the Union Administration Office beginning Tuesday, July 23.
item.author: Students

item.title: CCPD to Hold URP/Handshake Faculty Training Session July 29
item.description: On Monday, July 29 from 1:00PM to 2:30PM in the CCPD conference room, the CCPD will host an interactive opportunity for faculty members to learn how to use Handshake for posting undergraduate research positions. Lunch will be provided. Space is limited, so interested faculty should submit a registration webform to sign up as soon as possible.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: MBA for Professionals Review Scheduled for July 24
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, July 24, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
